txt.en: Wait by the flat stone for Karazgar to arrive and claim his prize
Remain on your guard
Talk to Karazgar at the Old Ford
You have chosen to deliver the Black Book of Mordor to Karazgar, and should wait by the flat stone in the Old Ford until he arrives to claim his prize.
Karazgar has come to meet with you at the Old Ford.
DNT - Blah!
Karazgar has asked you a question, and awaits your answer.
You have decided to deliver the Black Book of Mordor to Karazgar, as he requested.
Karazgar has asked you a question, and awaits your response.

'I see you have brought the tome with you, [placeholder]. Do you intend to honour our agreement?'

You tell Karazgar that you will give him the Black Book of Mordor, and he smiles.

'I am pleased you were willing to listen to reason, [placeholder].'
DNT - Blah!

'Give to me this artifact and I will leave you be.'

Karazgar holds out his hand, and when you do not immediately give him the Black Book he scowls.

'Why do you hesitate? You risk the wrath of Karazgar, [placeholder].'

You tell him the Book is not without cost, and there are conditions attached to this gift.
DNT - Blah!
Karazgar waits to hear your conditions.
Karazgar has agreed to your conditions, and waits for you to set the Black Book on the flat stone.
Karazgar has taken the Black Book of Mordor.
'DNT - Blah!'
Karazgar has come to meet with you at the Old Ford.
The Weeping Warrior has arrived at last
Karazgar has come to meet with you at the Old Ford.
'But you are wrong. I accept.'
'Set the book down on that flat stone.'
'You have my thanks for this, [placeholder].'
'Until we meet again.'
'Far from here... of course.'
'I know your demands. You think I will not agree.'
'Is that so?'
Answer Karazgar
'Your reasons are your own, and I will not judge them.'
Answer Karazgar
'What are these conditions?'
'My spies tell me you have something for me, [placeholder].'
'That seems fair. I will bring fear to these lands no longer.'
'Doubt not that I have eyes everywhere.'
Talk to Karazgar at the Old Ford
'Is that all?'
'Why, even dragon-flies serve me, and bring me news from afar.'
'I have only one question, [placeholder].'
Give Karazgar your conditions
'That land is mine!'
'Why have you decided to aid me?'
Place the Black Book of Mordor on the flat stone
'Fine. Let the dwarves keep it. I care not.'
'Wisdom, you say? Hmm...'
Remain on your guard
'Is that all?'
'You are wise indeed not to risk my further wrath.'
'Bah! You ask too much!'
'Do you now? You are right to see it.'
'Hmmph. Hrímil can rot, for all I care. I am done with dragons.'
'Am I not Karazgar, mightiest of the Gúrzyul?'
Instance: Closing the Book
